summary: This document outlines the Aircraft Security Agreement between ThorAir, LLC and Fifth Third Bank, detailing the security interests in the Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A aircraft, including its registration, ownership, and obligations related to maintenance, insurance, and potential events of loss. It establishes the rights and responsibilities of both parties regarding the aircraft and its financing. This document outlines the Aircraft Mortgage and Security Agreement between Flight Options, LLC and FO Financing, LLC, detailing the terms of the mortgage on a Raytheon Aircraft Company model 400A and its engines. It includes provisions for the maintenance, operation, and insurance of the aircraft, as well as the rights and obligations of both parties in the event of default.

keyFacts: The aircraft in question is a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A with serial number RK-244.
ThorAir, LLC is the registered owner of the aircraft.
Fifth Third Bank holds a first priority security interest in the aircraft as collateral for financing.
The aircraft is scheduled for international flights, requiring compliance with FAA regulations.
Multiple entities hold ownership interests in the aircraft, including Flight Options, LLC and various individuals.
The document is an Aircraft Mortgage and Security Agreement executed on July 8, 2010.
Flight Options, LLC holds a 12.50% interest in the Raytheon Aircraft Company model 400A with registration number N493LX.
The mortgage secures the aircraft and its engines, which are subject to various operational and maintenance covenants.
Bret Wiener and Edward T. McDonald are key signatories representing their respective companies.
The agreement includes provisions for the rights of the mortgagee in case of default.
